TMDA Download

Latest Release:
Download the latest release of TMDA as a gzipped tarball.
(Optional) Download the latest release of tmda-cgi as a gzipped tarball.

Packages:
(NOTE: Packages maintained by extraneous parties may not be caught up with the latest release)
  • Linux RPM: See the installation page for how to easily build an RPM directly from the source tarball.

  • Debian Linux Package (NOTE: Please download the most recent TMDA package available; the outdated testing or stable packages are not recommended)

  • TMDA is part of Mandrake Linux Contribs

  • Gentoo Linux Package

  • *BSD ports/packages:

    • NetBSD (mail/tmda)
    • OpenBSD (mail/tmda)
    • FreeBSD (mail/tmda)

Old Releases:
Past releases are available for download as well.

Development Sources:
For those who prefer the bleeding edge. If you are using non-released code, you should be reading the tmda-cvs mailing list to stay abreast of changes.

  • CVS Access:
    The TMDA development sources can be accessed via anonymous (pserver) CVS through module tmda.

  • Nightly Snapshots:
    Snapshots of the current development sources are checked out from CVS and tarballed each morning at 05:00 UTC.
rsync access:
  • The TMDA web site is available via anonymous rsync at rsync://tmda.net/tmdaweb/
    This includes all the HTML pages as well as the releases/ and snapshots/ directories.
